channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein’s Conviction Overturned by NY Appeals Court: Key Takeaways
item.description: The Court of Appeals overturned Harvey Weinstein’s 2020 conviction on sex crimes charges in New York, but he is not a free man. Here’s what to know.

item.title: ‘We’re Aware of the Location’: Aid Groups in Gaza Coordinated With I.D.F. but Still Came Under Fire
item.description: Visual evidence and internal communications obtained by The Times show six aid groups based in Western countries, including Israel’s strongest allies, had humanitarian sites hit by Israeli strikes, even after the locations were shared with the I.D.F.

item.title: Fortune Future of Finance Livestream
item.description: The summit will welcome to the stage everyone from senior Wall Street executives to next-generation finance leaders.

item.title: David Pecker, Trump’s Trash Collector, Got Cold Feet
item.description: He grew wary of his role suppressing bad stories about Trump.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.S. and 17 Other Nations Call on Hamas to Release Hostages
item.description: “The fate of the hostages and the civilian population in Gaza, who are protected under international law, is of international concern,” the leaders said in a joint statement.

item.title: Biden's labor secretary touts auto union's win in the South: 'That choice belongs to the workers'
item.description: Workers at a Chattanooga VW plant voted 3-to-1 to join the UAW, a choice Tennessee's governor called "a mistake."

item.title: José Andrés Eulogizes 7 World Central Kitchen Workers Killed in Gaza
item.description: The chef voiced “regret, sorrow and anger” at a Washington memorial for the workers slain while delivering food for his World Central Kitchen.

item.title: Israel’s Claim of Killing ‘Half’ of Hezbollah Commanders in Lebanon Draws Skepticism
item.description: The assertion is just “psychological warfare,” says one Lebanese expert on the militant group.

item.title: British PM wants to reform the country’s disability benefits by ending ‘sick note culture’ that 'overmedicalizes everyday challenges’
item.description: In a speech proposing reforms to Britain’s welfare system prime minister Rishi Sunak said people with “less severe” mental health conditions should still be in the workforce.

item.title: Takeaways from Supreme Court Arguments on Trump’s Immunity Claim
item.description: Several justices signaled interest in some protections for official acts, which could impede a swift trial in the federal election subversion case.

item.title: U.S. Army Begins Building Floating Aid Pier off Gaza, Pentagon Says
item.description: The structure is meant to allow humanitarian assistance to enter Gaza via the Mediterranean Sea, bypassing Israeli restrictions on land convoys.

item.title: Hertz is done gambling with EVs: It took a first-quarter $195 million hit on Teslas that just keep losing value and can’t sell them fast enough
item.description: Three years ago, investing in a fleet of 100,000 is what helped the car rental company emerge from bankruptcy.

item.title: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Limit Trump Election Case After Immunity Hearing
item.description: Such a ruling would probably send the case back to a lower court and could delay any trial until after the November election.

item.title: Venice Implements Entry Fee to Deter Tourists
item.description: Venice’s first day of charging a fee to enter the historic center went mostly smoothly, but there were some protests and polemics.

item.title: USC cancels May graduation ceremony as concerns mount about pro-Palestinian protests on college campuses
item.description: USC announced the cancellation of the May 10 ceremony a day after more than 90 protesters were arrested on campus.
